results.name: Beginning position of n in the decimal expansion of the Champernowne constant.
comment: Ignoring the initial 0 to the left of the decimal point.
Same as A031297 but including the a(0) term.
link: Eric W. Weisstein, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..999
